title: Couple accused of beating their six children , aged 5 to 15
text:
A West Virginia couple beat their six children with belts and metal objects and forced them to do push-ups and squats as punishment, it was claimed.

News outlets report Mannington police on Sunday arrested Bashtlee Efaw, 38, and her husband, Richard Douglas Efaw, 45.

Police Chief Brian Stewart said at times the punishment would last from the time the children arrived home from school until they went to bed.

Richard Douglas Efaw, 45, (left), and his wife Bashtlee Efaw, 38, (right), are accused of beating their six children with belts and metal objects and forcing them to do excessive exercise

He says the children complained of knee pain after being forced to do as many as 500 squats at a time.

The alleged abuse took place at the Efaw’s home at 306 Buffalo St in Mannington, The Register-Herald reported.

Stewart said he took appropriate steps to obtain a warrant for the arrests of the couple after finding probable cause.

The children, who range in age from 5 to 15, were placed under the care of Child Protective Services.

'Multiple disclosures of abuse were made by the children in which they described being abused by Bashtlee Efaw and Richard Efaw over an extended period of time.

'The abuse consisted of the children being whipped with belts on the buttocks, arms and head causing scars,' Stewart said in a prepared statement.

The children told Stewart and Child Protective Services that the squats were described as a set of 100.

'At times, the children were forced to do as many as 500 squats. The children complained of pain in their knees as a result of this particular punishment.

The alleged abuse took place at the Efaw’s home at 306 Buffalo St in Mannington, The Register-Herald reported. The area is pictured above

'The children were punished by being made to stand with their noses touching a wall, with their hands behind their backs,' Stewart stated.

The alleged victims told officials they were forced to endure this type of punishment 'for entire days at a time.'

'Sometimes this punishment was started when they arrived home from school around 3 p.m. and would last until they went to bed at 9 p.m.

'They disclosed that this punishment would often continue into the next day or days,' said Stewart.

Police said a piece of metal conduit with wiring inside was used for whipping a child.

They stated that the children were struck in the mouths with the backs of the adults hands which caused one child to bleed.

The Efaws each face one count each of child abuse resulting in great injury. Stewart said the children are now safe and the case is still under investigation.

He told WDTV: 'As far as child abuse cases that aren't sex-related, this is one of the worst ones I've worked.

'They [the children] appear to be a lot happier. They're in a good place right now.'

Bashtlee and Richard Efaw are being held at North Central Regional jail and their bail is set at $50,012 each.
description: West Virginia couple Richard Douglas Efaw, 45, and Bashtlee Efaw, 38, are accused of beating their children with metal objects and forcing them to do  exercises which lasted for days at a time.
